security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill containing no executable code. Only provides database best practices, review checklists, and code examples for educational purposes.

content.user_title: Review database code with best practices
content.value_statement: Database mistakes cause slow applications and data loss. This skill provides comprehensive review checklists for schema design, queries, ORM patterns, and migrations.
actual_capabilities: Review schema design for normalization and data type choices
Check queries for N+1 problems and missing pagination
Recommend indexes for frequently queried columns
Verify migration safety and rollback options
Identify SQL injection vulnerabilities in string concatenation
limitations: Does not execute queries or connect to databases
Does not generate migration files or schema definitions
Cannot test query performance on live databases
Does not provide database-specific optimization for all dialects

use_cases.title: Review ORM model definitions
use_cases.description: Check foreign key relationships, data types, and proper indexing on ORM models

use_cases.title: Learn query optimization
use_cases.description: Understand why SELECT * and N+1 queries cause problems and how to fix them

use_cases.title: Validate migration safety
use_cases.description: Ensure migrations can be rolled back and will not cause data loss

prompt_templates.title: Schema review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this database schema for normalization issues, missing primary keys, and improper data types

prompt_templates.title: Query optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these queries for performance issues including missing indexes and N+1 problems

prompt_templates.title: Migration safety
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if this migration can be safely rolled back without data loss

prompt_templates.title: ORM patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this ORM code for best practices including eager loading and parameterized queries

output_examples.input: Review this query for optimization: SELECT * FROM orders WHERE user_id = ?
output: - SELECT * returns unnecessary columns. Specify only needed fields.
- Missing index on user_id column for faster lookups.
- Consider adding pagination with LIMIT if this query returns many rows.
Recommended: SELECT id, status, total FROM orders WHERE user_id = ? LIMIT 50

best_practices: Always use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection attacks
Add indexes for columns used in WHERE, JOIN, and ORDER BY clauses
Test migrations on production-like data before deployment
anti_patterns: Using SELECT * instead of specifying required columns
Writing migrations that cannot be rolled back

faq.question: Which database systems are supported?
faq.answer: This skill covers general SQL principles that apply to PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and other relational databases.

faq.question: Does this work with NoSQL databases like MongoDB?
faq.answer: Some concepts like indexing and query optimization apply, but schema normalization and foreign keys are SQL-specific.

faq.question: Can this generate migration files?
faq.answer: No, this skill reviews existing code and migrations. It does not generate or execute database schema changes.

faq.question: Is data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reviews text/code. It never connects to databases or executes queries.

faq.question: What if queries still run slowly after applying recommendations?
faq.answer: Use EXPLAIN ANALYZE on your database to identify specific bottlenecks. Complex queries may need query planning or caching.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: Linters check syntax. This skill reviews design decisions like schema structure, relationships, and migration strategy.
